page.title: 01NORTH FROM KENSALEYRE
page.content: The main road of North Skye runs S.E. /N.W. To the west lies Loch Snizart Beag, to the east the moorlands and hills of Trotternish. Across the Loch is Aird Bernisdale, the tip of a small peninsula jutting into the loch. Much of the flat land is laid out in regular patterns (called crofts), many with modern houses - old homes rarely being renovated. Sparsely populated. the working adults rely on more than one occupation, with crofting being the secondary. Crofting today, mostly, meaning keeping sheep. 'Bed and Breakfast' is a typical summer occupation to serve the many tourists visiting Skye. Area supports a well-established garden nursery, owner makes his own compost. There is a small post office, which is also a small grocers serving local needs. Moorlands are peat covered and
